question: a simplified representation of something more complex. For example, a programmer will define functions to organize/clean up their code in order to reduce complexity and increase readability and efficiency
a set of instructions that can be followed to solve a problem, especially by a computer.
a value that is passed between programs, scripts or functions. Information sent to a function to customize it for a specific need.
the American Standard Code for Information Interchange. It is the most common format for representing text characters

answer: Assignment operator        the operator used to assign a new value to a variable. In Python, =

question: transmission capacity measure by bit rate
a counting system that includes 0-9, A-Z in both upper and lowercase, and other characters.
a base 2 counting system that uses only two characters, 0 and 1.
a column in the binary counting system with either a zero or a one. A Binary Digit.
the number of bits that are sent or processed per unit of time. e.g. 8 bits/sec.
a data type that stores one of two possible values: True or False
a math equation that is either true or false
a variable that is either true or false
process of naming multi-word variables without spaces and so that words in the middle of the phrase begins with a capital letter. For example, numberOfCars, iPhone, eBay
can be read in the code but does not affect the code in anyway.
one or more characters that examine two values and return either True or False. For example, greater than, less than, equal to, etc.
also known as selection, a statement that uses a boolean condition to determine whether or not to run other statements. Usually an if-then statement
basic organizing systems for code which include iteration, selection, and sequencing
a base 10 counting system that uses the characters 0-9
a numeral based on the counting system you are using. Ex. (base 10 = 0-9)
returns True if the value on the left is equal to the value on the right, otherwise it returns False. In Python, it is the characters ==
a script that does not run when the program is executed, but instead only occurs when a specific user input occurs. For example, when the space bar key is pressed
a floating-point decimal number. For example, 42.5, 0.001, or -3.729.

a named group of programming instructions that performs a specific task separately from a main script and returns to the main script when it is complete. Reusable abstractions that reduce the complexity of writing and maintaining programs.
a request that runs the code inside of a function
a block of code that includes the keyword def followed by a name, any arguments that are required, code inside the function, and an output that is returned
an 8-bit, base 16 counting system that uses the characters 0-9 and A-F
allows you to use commands that are not built-in to Python. For example, tkinter windows, random numbers, math functions, or turtles.
information that is given to the computer by a user, usually typed text and mouse clicks
a whole number. For example, 42, 0, or -3729.
also known as a loop, a control structure in which commands are repeated either a set number of times, until a boolean condition is met, or forever
the time it takes for a bit to travel from its sender to its receiver
variables created inside a function definition, that cannot be used outside the function
a mathematical character that takes two numbers and performs a calculation on them. For example, +
a 3-bit, base 8 counting system that uses the characters 0-7
information that is given to the user by a computer, usually text, images, and sound
a message or symbol indicating that the computer is waiting for user to provide input
a set of rules governing the exchange or transmission of data between devices
a keyword that tells the program to leave the function and send back a value

or use a variable, typically derived from where the variable was first created

organizing commands in the correct order
an independent 2D graphic that can be given commands which define how it behaves
a data type that stores a sequence of characters which could include letters, numbers, spaces, symbols and punctuation. For example,
the set of rules that defines a correctly structured document in a language
a character or string incorrectly placed in a command or instruction that causes a failure in execution
a named storage location that can store changeable information, depending on conditions or on information passed to the program. A number, string, or boolean that can be set, changed, and recalled
